text: As a general rule in these algorithms assignments, if you can arrange to complete the assignment with only one execution of a program, then you should.  If I said that you should vary the cutoff via a command line argument, then you can either do it that way (by writing a shell script) or you can have your main program run a for loop to invoke your experiment, passing in the argument as you go. It all basically comes to the same thing.
In order to notice any significant differences, you will need to sort some very large datasets. Special bonus for anyone who runs their code on a cluster (e.g. AWS).
Hi Professor, could you allow resubmission on blackboard?
